intro: Elodea canadensis var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaf waterweed, is a species of aquatic plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, ribbon-like leaves that are typically 1–3 cm in length. This variety thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Its stems are flexible and often form dense underwater mats. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually submerged, followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits containing numerous seeds.
